description: Amendments to planning permission dated 7 August 2020 (RN: 19/07063/FULL) for Use of the building (lower ground and ground of nos. 78 and 80 as a restaurant (Class A3), use of lower ground, ground and first floors of no. 82 as a public house (Class A4) and use of upper floors as office (Class B1), together with extension to the rear of the existing buildings and the installation of a lift, provision of a roof terrace, installation of plant equipment, facade treatments, installation of a lift overrun and associated works (site includes 78-82 Duke Street). (Part of land use package with 18 Balderton Street and 64-66 Duke Street), NAMELY to allow increase in width to the service door from George Yard; introduction of ventilation louvres to the Duke Street and Brown Hart Gardens shopfronts; replacement of approved door to roof terrace with sash window at third floor level; marginal increase in height of the approved lift overrun, in addition to a green roof; reconfiguration of approved mechanical plant at fourth floor level and introduction of a green roof; confirmation of size of mechanical plant at third floor level plant area; rationalisation of main roof plant and confirmation of size of mechanical plant; increase in roof height of 80 and 82 Duke Street; increase in height of kitchen extract duct in roof area to 80 Duke Street.
